"A Tale of Two Skylines" http://farm5.static.flickr.com/4092/5088126167_9f6921f3a6_s.jpg From Victoria Peak, you can see a view of the two skylines that, together, create the city we recognize as Hong Kong.  In the foreground is Hong Kong proper, situated on Hong Kong Island.  Across Victoria Harbour is Kowloon Peninsula, which borders the Chinese mainland 20 miles (32 km) to the north.

In this photo, you can also see Hong Kong's two tallest buildings, the International Finance Center 2 (IFC2) in the foreground to the extreme right of the frame.  On the Kowloon side, you can see the International Commerce Center (ICC), the city's tallest.  It is not unusual to misname the two buildings given the similarities of their acronyms, in addition to their appearances in design and height.

TIA INTERNATIONAL PHOTOGRAPHY / TIA Facebook / TIA Twitter 22.268997, 114.150073 Hong Kong, China, East, Asia, Pacific, Victoria, Peak, metropolis, architecture, cosmopolitan

Shanghai - Lujiazui, over the tops http://farm5.static.flickr.com/4141/4900246880_b3a59a657a_s.jpg Some of the skyscrapers in the Lujiazui Financial District:

 London  | Architecture  | Night  Photography   | London Underground


==========================================================================

Docklands is the semi-official name for an area in northeast and southeast London, England. It forms part of the boroughs of Southwark, Tower Hamlets, Newham and Greenwich. The docks were formerly part of the Port of London, at one time the world's largest port. They have now been redeveloped principally for commercial and residential use. The name London Docklands  was used for the first time in a government report on redevelopment plans in 1971 but has since become virtually universally adopted. It also created conflict between the new and old communities of the London Docklands.

en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London_Docklands

==========================================================================


London (pronounced /ˈlʌndən/) is the capital of England and the United Kingdom. A major settlement for two millennia, its history goes back to its founding by the Romans, who called it Londinium.London's core, the ancient City of London, the 'square mile', retains its mediaeval boundaries. Since at least the nineteenth century, the name "London" has also referred to the metropolis developed around it.Today, the bulk of this conurbation forms the London region and the Greater London administrative area,with its own elected mayor and assembly.

London is a major global city and one of the world's largest financial centres with the largest city GDP in Europe. Central London is home to the headquarters of most of the UK's top 100 listed companies (the FTSE 100) and more than 100 of Europe's 500 largest. London's influence in politics, finance, education, entertainment, media, fashion, the arts and culture in general contributes to its global position. It is a 51.509517, -0.016565 Tunnel, Light, Poplar, Docklands, Architecture poplar2010, artofimages, bestcapturesaoi, greatphotographers, Colors, Blue

Le Mont-Saint-Michel **France** http://farm8.static.flickr.com/7103/7386227514_45d941fc47_s.jpg If you enjoy my work and want to support me, you can join my Facebook page
Push there the  "Like Button" and  enjoy my pictures and much, much more! ;)   
Click this link:Oliver Botor Photography

Please press "L" for the best view!




































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































All of the pictures are © copyright by Oliver Botor "All rights are reserved" worldwide. 
Please do not use, copy or edit any of my photographs. However please feel free to contact 
with me if you are interested in using any of my images.









--English Version--




Le Mont-St-Michel was used in the 6th and 7th centuries as a stronghold of Romano-British 
culture and power until it was sacked by the Franks; thus ending the trans-channel culture that 
had stood since the departure of the Romans in 459 AD. Before the construction of the first 
monastic establishment in the 8th century, the island was called Mont Tombe. According to 
legend, the archangel Michael appeared to St. Aubert, bishop of Avranches, in 708 and instructed 
him to build a church on the rocky islet. But Aubert repeatedly ignored the angel's instruction until 
Michael burned a hole in the bishop's skull with his finger. That did the trick. The dedication to St 
Michael occurred on October 16, 708. The mount gained strategic significance in 933 when the
Normans annexed the Cotentin Peninsula, thereby placing the mount on the new frontier with 
Brittan 48.636081, -1.51083 France, Mont, Saint, St, Michel, Frankreich, Night, nightshot, nachtaufnahme, light

Looming Giants http://farm9.static.flickr.com/8007/7135903121_534db71910_s.jpg 50.113567, 8.668604 Frankfurt, Frankfurt am Main, FFM, Mainhattan, Skyscraper, Highrise, Hochhaus, Sky, Scraper, Deutsche

Un dimanche matin http://farm7.static.flickr.com/6115/6372195821_c2ec9fb9bd_s.jpg Le 20 novembre 2011 au matin :

Sceaux est célèbre pour son immense parc (parc départemental de Sceaux, dessiné par André Le Nôtre, comptant 181 ha dont 120 sur la commune de Sceaux), vestige du domaine personnel de Colbert dont l'imposant château fut détruit sous le Consulat.

Ce château fut la résidence de la duchesse du Maine, bru de Louis XIV.

Le château de Sceaux actuel, beaucoup plus petit, édifié par le deuxième duc de Trévise, fils du maréchal Mortier, sous le Second Empire, est de style néo - Louis XIII.

Le château actuel abrite le musée de la région Île-de-France. Ce musée possède l'une des plus importantes collections d'œuvres de peintres français figuratifs de l'Ecole de Paris et notamment de Maurice Boitel (quatre œuvres) et de Charles Forget.

Le musée est complété par un centre de documentation spécialisé sur l'histoire, l'architecture et le patrimoine de la région.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sceaux is a commune in the southern suburbs of Paris, France. It is located 9.7 km (6.0 mi) from the center of Paris famous for the Château of Sceaux, set in its large park (Parc départemental de Sceaux), designed by André Le Nôtre, measuring 2 km2 (0.77 sq mi). 

The original château, demolished during the Revolution, was built by Jean-Baptiste Colbert, the minister of finance to Louis XIV and purchased by Louis' illegitimate son, the duke of Maine in 1699. His duchesse held court in a glittering salon at Sceaux in the first decades of the eighteenth century.

The present château, rebuilt 1856-62 in a Louis XIII style, is now the museum of Île-de-France open for visits.

"A Tale of Two Skylines" http://farm5.static.flickr.com/4092/5088126167_9f6921f3a6_s.jpg From Victoria Peak, you can see a view of the two skylines that, together, create the city we recognize as Hong Kong.  In the foreground is Hong Kong proper, situated on Hong Kong Island.  Across Victoria Harbour is Kowloon Peninsula, which borders the Chinese mainland 20 miles (32 km) to the north.

In this photo, you can also see Hong Kong's two tallest buildings, the International Finance Center 2 (IFC2) in the foreground to the extreme right of the frame.  On the Kowloon side, you can see the International Commerce Center (ICC), the city's tallest.  It is not unusual to misname the two buildings given the similarities of their acronyms, in addition to their appearances in design and height.

 London  | Architecture  | Night  Photography   | London Underground


==========================================================================

Docklands is the semi-official name for an area in northeast and southeast London, England. It forms part of the boroughs of Southwark, Tower Hamlets, Newham and Greenwich. The docks were formerly part of the Port of London, at one time the world's largest port. They have now been redeveloped principally for commercial and residential use. The name London Docklands  was used for the first time in a government report on redevelopment plans in 1971 but has since become virtually universally adopted. It also created conflict between the new and old communities of the London Docklands.

en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London_Docklands

==========================================================================


London (pronounced /ˈlʌndən/) is the capital of England and the United Kingdom. A major settlement for two millennia, its history goes back to its founding by the Romans, who called it Londinium.London's core, the ancient City of London, the 'square mile', retains its mediaeval boundaries. Since at least the nineteenth century, the name "London" has also referred to the metropolis developed around it.Today, the bulk of this conurbation forms the London region and the Greater London administrative area,with its own elected mayor and assembly.

London is a major global city and one of the world's largest financial centres with the largest city GDP in Europe. Central London is home to the headquarters of most of the UK's top 100 listed companies (the FTSE 100) and more than 100 of Europe's 500 largest. London's influence in politics, finance, education, entertainment, media, fashion, the arts and culture in general contributes to its global position. It is a 51.509517, -0.016565 Tunnel, Light, Poplar, Docklands, Architecture poplar2010, artofimages, bestcapturesaoi, greatphotographers, Colors, Blue

Le Mont-Saint-Michel **France** http://farm8.static.flickr.com/7103/7386227514_45d941fc47_s.jpg If you enjoy my work and want to support me, you can join my Facebook page
Push there the  "Like Button" and  enjoy my pictures and much, much more! ;)   
Click this link:Oliver Botor Photography

Please press "L" for the best view!

--English Version--




Le Mont-St-Michel was used in the 6th and 7th centuries as a stronghold of Romano-British 
culture and power until it was sacked by the Franks; thus ending the trans-channel culture that 
had stood since the departure of the Romans in 459 AD. Before the construction of the first 
monastic establishment in the 8th century, the island was called Mont Tombe. According to 
legend, the archangel Michael appeared to St. Aubert, bishop of Avranches, in 708 and instructed 
him to build a church on the rocky islet. But Aubert repeatedly ignored the angel's instruction until 
Michael burned a hole in the bishop's skull with his finger. That did the trick. The dedication to St 
Michael occurred on October 16, 708. The mount gained strategic significance in 933 when the
Normans annexed the Cotentin Peninsula, thereby placing the mount on the new frontier with 
Brittan 48.636081, -1.51083 France, Mont, Saint, St, Michel, Frankreich, Night, nightshot, nachtaufnahme, light

Looming Giants http://farm9.static.flickr.com/8007/7135903121_534db71910_s.jpg 50.113567, 8.668604 Frankfurt, Frankfurt am Main, FFM, Mainhattan, Skyscraper, Highrise, Hochhaus, Sky, Scraper, Deutsche

Un dimanche matin http://farm7.static.flickr.com/6115/6372195821_c2ec9fb9bd_s.jpg Le 20 novembre 2011 au matin :

Sceaux est célèbre pour son immense parc (parc départemental de Sceaux, dessiné par André Le Nôtre, comptant 181 ha dont 120 sur la commune de Sceaux), vestige du domaine personnel de Colbert dont l'imposant château fut détruit sous le Consulat.

Ce château fut la résidence de la duchesse du Maine, bru de Louis XIV.

Le château de Sceaux actuel, beaucoup plus petit, édifié par le deuxième duc de Trévise, fils du maréchal Mortier, sous le Second Empire, est de style néo - Louis XIII.

Le château actuel abrite le musée de la région Île-de-France. Ce musée possède l'une des plus importantes collections d'œuvres de peintres français figuratifs de l'Ecole de Paris et notamment de Maurice Boitel (quatre œuvres) et de Charles Forget.

Le musée est complété par un centre de documentation spécialisé sur l'histoire, l'architecture et le patrimoine de la région.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sceaux is a commune in the southern suburbs of Paris, France. It is located 9.7 km (6.0 mi) from the center of Paris famous for the Château of Sceaux, set in its large park (Parc départemental de Sceaux), designed by André Le Nôtre, measuring 2 km2 (0.77 sq mi). 

The original château, demolished during the Revolution, was built by Jean-Baptiste Colbert, the minister of finance to Louis XIV and purchased by Louis' illegitimate son, the duke of Maine in 1699. His duchesse held court in a glittering salon at Sceaux in the first decades of the eighteenth century.

The present château, rebuilt 1856-62 in a Louis XIII style, is now the museum of Île-de-France open for visits.

 London  | Architecture  | Night  Photography   | London Underground


==========================================================================

Docklands is the semi-official name for an area in northeast and southeast London, England. It forms part of the boroughs of Southwark, Tower Hamlets, Newham and Greenwich. The docks were formerly part of the Port of London, at one time the world's largest port. They have now been redeveloped principally for commercial and residential use. The name London Docklands  was used for the first time in a government report on redevelopment plans in 1971 but has since become virtually universally adopted. It also created conflict between the new and old communities of the London Docklands.

en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London_Docklands

==========================================================================


London (pronounced /ˈlʌndən/) is the capital of England and the United Kingdom. A major settlement for two millennia, its history goes back to its founding by the Romans, who called it Londinium.London's core, the ancient City of London, the 'square mile', retains its mediaeval boundaries. Since at least the nineteenth century, the name "London" has also referred to the metropolis developed around it.Today, the bulk of this conurbation forms the London region and the Greater London administrative area,with its own elected mayor and assembly.

London is a major global city and one of the world's largest financial centres with the largest city GDP in Europe. Central London is home to the headquarters of most of the UK's top 100 listed companies (the FTSE 100) and more than 100 of Europe's 500 largest. London's influence in politics, finance, education, entertainment, media, fashion, the arts and culture in general contributes to its global position. Billomat | Rechnungen einfach online schreiben. http://www.billomat.com/ In der Cloud Weil Billomat ausschließlich im Internet lebt, arbeitest du stets mit der aktuellsten Version und profitierst automatisch von neuen Features. International Billomat ist komplett in 5 Sprachen lokalisiert und wird von Kunden aus der ganzen Welt genutzt. Sicherheit Alle Daten werden SSL- verschlüsselt übertragen und sind in unserem Rechenzentrum mehrfach redundant als Backup verfügbar. Mehr zur Sicherheit » Umweltfreundlich Mit Billomat sparst du Papier, Tinte und Energie. Das schont die natürlichen Ressourcen und die Umwelt. Schnittstellen Mit integrierten Add-Ons oder offener REST-API Daten mit anderen Diensten austauschen. Ob Zeiterfassung, Projektmanagement, Briefversand, … Support Auch auf Twitter Bei Billomat arbeiten echte Menschen, die du bei Fragen und Problemen zeitnah erreichen kannst. Wir helfen dir gerne weiter! Zum Support-Portal » accounting, billing, business, finance, service, software, webbased

Rechnung online erstellen, Kunden verwalten, Kosten im Überblick http://www.fastbill.com/ Vielseitig für alle Bereiche  des Arbeitsalltags.  Kunden verwalten, Angebote und Rechnungen erstellen, Projekte managen. Behalten Sie Einnahmen, Ausgaben und die Liquidität im Blick.  Zeitsparend beim täglichen Papierkram.  Arbeitszeiten erfassen und abrechnen, wiederkehrende Rechnungen automatisch erzeugen. Arbeiten Sie online, schnell und effizient.  Kollaborativ mit Kunden und im Team arbeiten.  Einfache Kundenverwaltung und Teamwork. Dank Rechtekonzept arbeiten Sie effizient mit Kollegen oder Dienstleistern.  Schlank auf das Wesentliche reduziert.  Komplexe Buchhaltungssoftware war gestern! FastBill ist schlank, intuitiv und hilft bei wichtigen Aufgaben. Schluß mit nerviger Bürokratie.  Mobil für räumliche und zeitliche Freiheit.  Dank Browser basierter Technologie können Sie flexibel und mobil an jedem Ort arbeiten. Keine Installation. Keine Updates. Keine Probleme.  Korrekt zur Erfüllung formaler Anforderungen.  Ob Kleinunternehmerregelung, steuerliche Rechnungsformalitäten oder digitale Signatur. Le Mont-Saint-Michel **France** http://farm8.static.flickr.com/7103/7386227514_45d941fc47_s.jpg If you enjoy my work and want to support me, you can join my Facebook page
Push there the  "Like Button" and  enjoy my pictures and much, much more! ;)   
Click this link:Oliver Botor Photography

Please press "L" for the best view!

--English Version--




Le Mont-St-Michel was used in the 6th and 7th centuries as a stronghold of Romano-British 
culture and power until it was sacked by the Franks; thus ending the trans-channel culture that 
had stood since the departure of the Romans in 459 AD. Before the construction of the first 
monastic establishment in the 8th century, the island was called Mont Tombe. According to 
legend, the archangel Michael appeared to St. Aubert, bishop of Avranches, in 708 and instructed 
him to build a church on the rocky islet. But Aubert repeatedly ignored the angel's instruction until 
Michael burned a hole in the bishop's skull with his finger. That did the trick. The dedication to St 
Michael occurred on October 16, 708. The mount gained strategic significance in 933 when the
Normans annexed the Cotentin Peninsula, thereby placing the mount on the new frontier with 
Brittan 48.636081, -1.51083 France, Mont, Saint, St, Michel, Frankreich, Night, nightshot, nachtaufnahme, light

Looming Giants http://farm9.static.flickr.com/8007/7135903121_534db71910_s.jpg 50.113567, 8.668604 Frankfurt, Frankfurt am Main, FFM, Mainhattan, Skyscraper, Highrise, Hochhaus, Sky, Scraper, Deutsche

Un dimanche matin http://farm7.static.flickr.com/6115/6372195821_c2ec9fb9bd_s.jpg Le 20 novembre 2011 au matin :

Sceaux est célèbre pour son immense parc (parc départemental de Sceaux, dessiné par André Le Nôtre, comptant 181 ha dont 120 sur la commune de Sceaux), vestige du domaine personnel de Colbert dont l'imposant château fut détruit sous le Consulat.

Ce château fut la résidence de la duchesse du Maine, bru de Louis XIV.

Le château de Sceaux actuel, beaucoup plus petit, édifié par le deuxième duc de Trévise, fils du maréchal Mortier, sous le Second Empire, est de style néo - Louis XIII.

Le château actuel abrite le musée de la région Île-de-France. Ce musée possède l'une des plus importantes collections d'œuvres de peintres français figuratifs de l'Ecole de Paris et notamment de Maurice Boitel (quatre œuvres) et de Charles Forget.

Le musée est complété par un centre de documentation spécialisé sur l'histoire, l'architecture et le patrimoine de la région.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sceaux is a commune in the southern suburbs of Paris, France. It is located 9.7 km (6.0 mi) from the center of Paris famous for the Château of Sceaux, set in its large park (Parc départemental de Sceaux), designed by André Le Nôtre, measuring 2 km2 (0.77 sq mi). 

The original château, demolished during the Revolution, was built by Jean-Baptiste Colbert, the minister of finance to Louis XIV and purchased by Louis' illegitimate son, the duke of Maine in 1699. His duchesse held court in a glittering salon at Sceaux in the first decades of the eighteenth century.

The present château, rebuilt 1856-62 in a Louis XIII style, is now the museum of Île-de-France open for visits.

Shanghai | Hazy Lujiazui - PuDong, Shanghai http://farm6.static.flickr.com/5286/5236424710_ae1a3211be_s.jpg The towers of Lujiazui Finance and Trade Zone (陆家嘴金融贸易区) at PuDong, Shanghai(上海浦东新区) - seen from The Bund.

"A Tale of Two Skylines" http://farm5.static.flickr.com/4092/5088126167_9f6921f3a6_s.jpg From Victoria Peak, you can see a view of the two skylines that, together, create the city we recognize as Hong Kong.  In the foreground is Hong Kong proper, situated on Hong Kong Island.  Across Victoria Harbour is Kowloon Peninsula, which borders the Chinese mainland 20 miles (32 km) to the north.

In this photo, you can also see Hong Kong's two tallest buildings, the International Finance Center 2 (IFC2) in the foreground to the extreme right of the frame.  On the Kowloon side, you can see the International Commerce Center (ICC), the city's tallest.  It is not unusual to misname the two buildings given the similarities of their acronyms, in addition to their appearances in design and height.

 London  | Architecture  | Night  Photography   | London Underground


==========================================================================

Docklands is the semi-official name for an area in northeast and southeast London, England. It forms part of the boroughs of Southwark, Tower Hamlets, Newham and Greenwich. The docks were formerly part of the Port of London, at one time the world's largest port. They have now been redeveloped principally for commercial and residential use. The name London Docklands  was used for the first time in a government report on redevelopment plans in 1971 but has since become virtually universally adopted. It also created conflict between the new and old communities of the London Docklands.

en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London_Docklands

==========================================================================


London (pronounced /ˈlʌndən/) is the capital of England and the United Kingdom. A major settlement for two millennia, its history goes back to its founding by the Romans, who called it Londinium.London's core, the ancient City of London, the 'square mile', retains its mediaeval boundaries. Since at least the nineteenth century, the name "London" has also referred to the metropolis developed around it.Today, the bulk of this conurbation forms the London region and the Greater London administrative area,with its own elected mayor and assembly.

London is a major global city and one of the world's largest financial centres with the largest city GDP in Europe. Central London is home to the headquarters of most of the UK's top 100 listed companies (the FTSE 100) and more than 100 of Europe's 500 largest. London's influence in politics, finance, education, entertainment, media, fashion, the arts and culture in general contributes to its global position. It is a 51.509517, -0.016565 Tunnel, Light, Poplar, Docklands, Architecture poplar2010, artofimages, bestcapturesaoi, greatphotographers, Colors, Blue

Le Mont-Saint-Michel **France** http://farm8.static.flickr.com/7103/7386227514_45d941fc47_s.jpg If you enjoy my work and want to support me, you can join my Facebook page

--English Version--




Le Mont-St-Michel was used in the 6th and 7th centuries as a stronghold of Romano-British 
culture and power until it was sacked by the Franks; thus ending the trans-channel culture that 
had stood since the departure of the Romans in 459 AD. Before the construction of the first 
monastic establishment in the 8th century, the island was called Mont Tombe. According to 
legend, the archangel Michael appeared to St. Aubert, bishop of Avranches, in 708 and instructed 
him to build a church on the rocky islet. But Aubert repeatedly ignored the angel's instruction until 
Michael burned a hole in the bishop's skull with his finger. That did the trick. The dedication to St 
Michael occurred on October 16, 708. The mount gained strategic significance in 933 when the
Normans annexed the Cotentin Peninsula, thereby placing the mount on the new frontier with 
Brittan 48.636081, -1.51083 France, Mont, Saint, St, Michel, Frankreich, Night, nightshot, nachtaufnahme, light

Looming Giants http://farm9.static.flickr.com/8007/7135903121_534db71910_s.jpg 50.113567, 8.668604 Frankfurt, Frankfurt am Main, FFM, Mainhattan, Skyscraper, Highrise, Hochhaus, Sky, Scraper, Deutsche

Un dimanche matin http://farm7.static.flickr.com/6115/6372195821_c2ec9fb9bd_s.jpg Le 20 novembre 2011 au matin :

Sceaux est célèbre pour son immense parc (parc départemental de Sceaux, dessiné par André Le Nôtre, comptant 181 ha dont 120 sur la commune de Sceaux), vestige du domaine personnel de Colbert dont l'imposant château fut détruit sous le Consulat.

Ce château fut la résidence de la duchesse du Maine, bru de Louis XIV.

Le château de Sceaux actuel, beaucoup plus petit, édifié par le deuxième duc de Trévise, fils du maréchal Mortier, sous le Second Empire, est de style néo - Louis XIII.

Le château actuel abrite le musée de la région Île-de-France. Ce musée possède l'une des plus importantes collections d'œuvres de peintres français figuratifs de l'Ecole de Paris et notamment de Maurice Boitel (quatre œuvres) et de Charles Forget.

Le musée est complété par un centre de documentation spécialisé sur l'histoire, l'architecture et le patrimoine de la région.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sceaux is a commune in the southern suburbs of Paris, France. It is located 9.7 km (6.0 mi) from the center of Paris famous for the Château of Sceaux, set in its large park (Parc départemental de Sceaux), designed by André Le Nôtre, measuring 2 km2 (0.77 sq mi). 

The original château, demolished during the Revolution, was built by Jean-Baptiste Colbert, the minister of finance to Louis XIV and purchased by Louis' illegitimate son, the duke of Maine in 1699. His duchesse held court in a glittering salon at Sceaux in the first decades of the eighteenth century.

The present château, rebuilt 1856-62 in a Louis XIII style, is now the museum of Île-de-France open for visits.

"A Tale of Two Skylines" http://farm5.static.flickr.com/4092/5088126167_9f6921f3a6_s.jpg From Victoria Peak, you can see a view of the two skylines that, together, create the city we recognize as Hong Kong.  In the foreground is Hong Kong proper, situated on Hong Kong Island.  Across Victoria Harbour is Kowloon Peninsula, which borders the Chinese mainland 20 miles (32 km) to the north.

In this photo, you can also see Hong Kong's two tallest buildings, the International Finance Center 2 (IFC2) in the foreground to the extreme right of the frame.  On the Kowloon side, you can see the International Commerce Center (ICC), the city's tallest.  It is not unusual to misname the two buildings given the similarities of their acronyms, in addition to their appearances in design and height.

TIA INTERNATIONAL PHOTOGRAPHY / TIA Facebook / TIA Twitter 22.268997, 114.150073 Hong Kong, China, East, Asia, Pacific, Victoria, Peak, metropolis, architecture, cosmopolitan

London Tunnel of Light - Docklands http://farm5.static.flickr.com/4003/4429084885_e5ec265abb_s.jpg   Please don't use this image on websites, blogs or other media without my explicit permission. © All rights reserved


TWITTER | WWW.DAVIDGUTIERREZ.CO.UK |  SAATCHI ONLINE | YOUTUBE | FACEBOOK | REDBUBBLE 




 London  | Architecture  | Night  Photography   | London Underground


==========================================================================

Docklands is the semi-official name for an area in northeast and southeast London, England. It forms part of the boroughs of Southwark, Tower Hamlets, Newham and Greenwich. The docks were formerly part of the Port of London, at one time the world's largest port. They have now been redeveloped principally for commercial and residential use. The name London Docklands  was used for the first time in a government report on redevelopment plans in 1971 but has since become virtually universally adopted. It also created conflict between the new and old communities of the London Docklands.

en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London_Docklands

==========================================================================


London (pronounced /ˈlʌndən/) is the capital of England and the United Kingdom. A major settlement for two millennia, its history goes back to its founding by the Romans, who called it Londinium.London's core, the ancient City of London, the 'square mile', retains its mediaeval boundaries. Since at least the nineteenth century, the name "London" has also referred to the metropolis developed around it.Today, the bulk of this conurbation forms the London region and the Greater London administrative area,with its own elected mayor and assembly.

London is a major global city and one of the world's largest financial centres with the largest city GDP in Europe. Central London is home to the headquarters of most of the UK's top 100 listed companies (the FTSE 100) and more than 100 of Europe's 500 largest. London's influence in politics, finance, education, entertainment, media, fashion, the arts and culture in general contributes to its global position. It is a 51.509517, -0.016565 Tunnel, Light, Poplar, Docklands, Architecture poplar2010, artofimages, bestcapturesaoi, greatphotographers, Colors, Blue

A crowd drawer  during the 13th Annual Winter Walk at the town of Hudson, New York.

Normans annexed the Cotentin Peninsula, thereby placing the mount on the new frontier with

Un dimanche matin http://farm7.static.flickr.com/6115/6372195821_c2ec9fb9bd_s.jpg Le 20 novembre 2011 au matin :

Sceaux est célèbre pour son immense parc (parc départemental de Sceaux, dessiné par André Le Nôtre, comptant 181 ha dont 120 sur la commune de Sceaux), vestige du domaine personnel de Colbert dont l'imposant château fut détruit sous le Consulat.

Ce château fut la résidence de la duchesse du Maine, bru de Louis XIV.

Le château de Sceaux actuel, beaucoup plus petit, édifié par le deuxième duc de Trévise, fils du maréchal Mortier, sous le Second Empire, est de style néo - Louis XIII.

Le château actuel abrite le musée de la région Île-de-France. Ce musée possède l'une des plus importantes collections d'œuvres de peintres français figuratifs de l'Ecole de Paris et notamment de Maurice Boitel (quatre œuvres) et de Charles Forget.

Le musée est complété par un centre de documentation spécialisé sur l'histoire, l'architecture et le patrimoine de la région.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sceaux is a commune in the southern suburbs of Paris, France. It is located 9.7 km (6.0 mi) from the center of Paris famous for the Château of Sceaux, set in its large park (Parc départemental de Sceaux), designed by André Le Nôtre, measuring 2 km2 (0.77 sq mi). 

The original château, demolished during the Revolution, was built by Jean-Baptiste Colbert, the minister of finance to Louis XIV and purchased by Louis' illegitimate son, the duke of Maine in 1699. His duchesse held court in a glittering salon at Sceaux in the first decades of the eighteenth century.

The present château, rebuilt 1856-62 in a Louis XIII style, is now the museum of Île-de-France open for visits.

3000 views at 2/1/11!! 31.245535, 121.482353 Shanghai, PuDong, 陆家嘴金融贸易区, 陆家嘴, 金融, 浦东新区, 浦东, China, Skyline, PuXi

"A Tale of Two Skylines" http://farm5.static.flickr.com/4092/5088126167_9f6921f3a6_s.jpg From Victoria Peak, you can see a view of the two skylines that, together, create the city we recognize as Hong Kong.  In the foreground is Hong Kong proper, situated on Hong Kong Island.  Across Victoria Harbour is Kowloon Peninsula, which borders the Chinese mainland 20 miles (32 km) to the north.

In this photo, you can also see Hong Kong's two tallest buildings, the International Finance Center 2 (IFC2) in the foreground to the extreme right of the frame.  On the Kowloon side, you can see the International Commerce Center (ICC), the city's tallest.  It is not unusual to misname the two buildings given the similarities of their acronyms, in addition to their appearances in design and height.

TWITTER | WWW.DAVIDGUTIERREZ.CO.UK |  SAATCHI ONLINE | YOUTUBE | FACEBOOK | REDBUBBLE 




 London  | Architecture  | Night  Photography   | London Underground


==========================================================================

Docklands is the semi-official name for an area in northeast and southeast London, England. It forms part of the boroughs of Southwark, Tower Hamlets, Newham and Greenwich. The docks were formerly part of the Port of London, at one time the world's largest port. They have now been redeveloped principally for commercial and residential use. The name London Docklands  was used for the first time in a government report on redevelopment plans in 1971 but has since become virtually universally adopted. It also created conflict between the new and old communities of the London Docklands.

en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London_Docklands

==========================================================================


London (pronounced /ˈlʌndən/) is the capital of England and the United Kingdom. A major settlement for two millennia, its history goes back to its founding by the Romans, who called it Londinium.London's core, the ancient City of London, the 'square mile', retains its mediaeval boundaries. Since at least the nineteenth century, the name "London" has also referred to the metropolis developed around it.Today, the bulk of this conurbation forms the London region and the Greater London administrative area,with its own elected mayor and assembly.

London is a major global city and one of the world's largest financial centres with the largest city GDP in Europe. Central London is home to the headquarters of most of the UK's top 100 listed companies (the FTSE 100) and more than 100 of Europe's 500 largest. London's influence in politics, finance, education, entertainment, media, fashion, the arts and culture in general contributes to its global position. It is a 51.509517, -0.016565 Tunnel, Light, Poplar, Docklands, Architecture poplar2010, artofimages, bestcapturesaoi, greatphotographers, Colors, Blue

If you like this, check out the New York Skyline - the original Gotham City.

Le Mont-Saint-Michel **France** http://farm8.static.flickr.com/7103/7386227514_45d941fc47_s.jpg If you enjoy my work and want to support me, you can join my Facebook page
Push there the  "Like Button" and  enjoy my pictures and much, much more! ;)   
Click this link:Oliver Botor Photography

Please press "L" for the best view!

--English Version--




Le Mont-St-Michel was used in the 6th and 7th centuries as a stronghold of Romano-British 
culture and power until it was sacked by the Franks; thus ending the trans-channel culture that 
had stood since the departure of the Romans in 459 AD. Before the construction of the first 
monastic establishment in the 8th century, the island was called Mont Tombe. According to 
legend, the archangel Michael appeared to St. Aubert, bishop of Avranches, in 708 and instructed 
him to build a church on the rocky islet. But Aubert repeatedly ignored the angel's instruction until 
Michael burned a hole in the bishop's skull with his finger. That did the trick. The dedication to St 
Michael occurred on October 16, 708. The mount gained strategic significance in 933 when the
Normans annexed the Cotentin Peninsula, thereby placing the mount on the new frontier with 
Brittan 48.636081, -1.51083 France, Mont, Saint, St, Michel, Frankreich, Night, nightshot, nachtaufnahme, light

Looming Giants http://farm9.static.flickr.com/8007/7135903121_534db71910_s.jpg 50.113567, 8.668604 Frankfurt, Frankfurt am Main, FFM, Mainhattan, Skyscraper, Highrise, Hochhaus, Sky, Scraper, Deutsche

Un dimanche matin http://farm7.static.flickr.com/6115/6372195821_c2ec9fb9bd_s.jpg Le 20 novembre 2011 au matin :

Sceaux est célèbre pour son immense parc (parc départemental de Sceaux, dessiné par André Le Nôtre, comptant 181 ha dont 120 sur la commune de Sceaux), vestige du domaine personnel de Colbert dont l'imposant château fut détruit sous le Consulat.

Ce château fut la résidence de la duchesse du Maine, bru de Louis XIV.

Le château de Sceaux actuel, beaucoup plus petit, édifié par le deuxième duc de Trévise, fils du maréchal Mortier, sous le Second Empire, est de style néo - Louis XIII.

Le château actuel abrite le musée de la région Île-de-France. Ce musée possède l'une des plus importantes collections d'œuvres de peintres français figuratifs de l'Ecole de Paris et notamment de Maurice Boitel (quatre œuvres) et de Charles Forget.

Le musée est complété par un centre de documentation spécialisé sur l'histoire, l'architecture et le patrimoine de la région.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sceaux is a commune in the southern suburbs of Paris, France. It is located 9.7 km (6.0 mi) from the center of Paris famous for the Château of Sceaux, set in its large park (Parc départemental de Sceaux), designed by André Le Nôtre, measuring 2 km2 (0.77 sq mi). 

The original château, demolished during the Revolution, was built by Jean-Baptiste Colbert, the minister of finance to Louis XIV and purchased by Louis' illegitimate son, the duke of Maine in 1699. His duchesse held court in a glittering salon at Sceaux in the first decades of the eighteenth century.

The present château, rebuilt 1856-62 in a Louis XIII style, is now the museum of Île-de-France open for visits.

Shanghai | Hazy Lujiazui - PuDong, Shanghai http://farm6.static.flickr.com/5286/5236424710_ae1a3211be_s.jpg The towers of Lujiazui Finance and Trade Zone (陆家嘴金融贸易区) at PuDong, Shanghai(上海浦东新区) - seen from The Bund.

"A Tale of Two Skylines" http://farm5.static.flickr.com/4092/5088126167_9f6921f3a6_s.jpg From Victoria Peak, you can see a view of the two skylines that, together, create the city we recognize as Hong Kong.  In the foreground is Hong Kong proper, situated on Hong Kong Island.  Across Victoria Harbour is Kowloon Peninsula, which borders the Chinese mainland 20 miles (32 km) to the north.

In this photo, you can also see Hong Kong's two tallest buildings, the International Finance Center 2 (IFC2) in the foreground to the extreme right of the frame.  On the Kowloon side, you can see the International Commerce Center (ICC), the city's tallest.  It is not unusual to misname the two buildings given the similarities of their acronyms, in addition to their appearances in design and height.

TWITTER | WWW.DAVIDGUTIERREZ.CO.UK |  SAATCHI ONLINE | YOUTUBE | FACEBOOK | REDBUBBLE 




 London  | Architecture  | Night  Photography   | London Underground


==========================================================================

Docklands is the semi-official name for an area in northeast and southeast London, England. It forms part of the boroughs of Southwark, Tower Hamlets, Newham and Greenwich. The docks were formerly part of the Port of London, at one time the world's largest port. They have now been redeveloped principally for commercial and residential use. The name London Docklands  was used for the first time in a government report on redevelopment plans in 1971 but has since become virtually universally adopted. It also created conflict between the new and old communities of the London Docklands.

en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London_Docklands

==========================================================================


London (pronounced /ˈlʌndən/) is the capital of England and the United Kingdom. A major settlement for two millennia, its history goes back to its founding by the Romans, who called it Londinium.London's core, the ancient City of London, the 'square mile', retains its mediaeval boundaries. Since at least the nineteenth century, the name "London" has also referred to the metropolis developed around it.Today, the bulk of this conurbation forms the London region and the Greater London administrative area,with its own elected mayor and assembly.

London is a major global city and one of the world's largest financial centres with the largest city GDP in Europe. Central London is home to the headquarters of most of the UK's top 100 listed companies (the FTSE 100) and more than 100 of Europe's 500 largest. London's influence in politics, finance, education, entertainment, media, fashion, the arts and culture in general contributes to its global position. Le Mont-Saint-Michel **France** http://farm8.static.flickr.com/7103/7386227514_45d941fc47_s.jpg If you enjoy my work and want to support me, you can join my Facebook page
Push there the  "Like Button" and  enjoy my pictures and much, much more! ;)   
Click this link:Oliver Botor Photography

Please press "L" for the best view!

--English Version--




Le Mont-St-Michel was used in the 6th and 7th centuries as a stronghold of Romano-British 
culture and power until it was sacked by the Franks; thus ending the trans-channel culture that 
had stood since the departure of the Romans in 459 AD. Before the construction of the first 
monastic establishment in the 8th century, the island was called Mont Tombe. According to 
legend, the archangel Michael appeared to St. Aubert, bishop of Avranches, in 708 and instructed 
him to build a church on the rocky islet. But Aubert repeatedly ignored the angel's instruction until 
Michael burned a hole in the bishop's skull with his finger. That did the trick. The dedication to St 
Michael occurred on October 16, 708. The mount gained strategic significance in 933 when the
Normans annexed the Cotentin Peninsula, thereby placing the mount on the new frontier with 
Brittan 48.636081, -1.51083 France, Mont, Saint, St, Michel, Frankreich, Night, nightshot, nachtaufnahme, light

Looming Giants http://farm9.static.flickr.com/8007/7135903121_534db71910_s.jpg 50.113567, 8.668604 Frankfurt, Frankfurt am Main, FFM, Mainhattan, Skyscraper, Highrise, Hochhaus, Sky, Scraper, Deutsche

Un dimanche matin http://farm7.static.flickr.com/6115/6372195821_c2ec9fb9bd_s.jpg Le 20 novembre 2011 au matin :

Sceaux est célèbre pour son immense parc (parc départemental de Sceaux, dessiné par André Le Nôtre, comptant 181 ha dont 120 sur la commune de Sceaux), vestige du domaine personnel de Colbert dont l'imposant château fut détruit sous le Consulat.

Ce château fut la résidence de la duchesse du Maine, bru de Louis XIV.

Le château de Sceaux actuel, beaucoup plus petit, édifié par le deuxième duc de Trévise, fils du maréchal Mortier, sous le Second Empire, est de style néo - Louis XIII.

Le château actuel abrite le musée de la région Île-de-France. Ce musée possède l'une des plus importantes collections d'œuvres de peintres français figuratifs de l'Ecole de Paris et notamment de Maurice Boitel (quatre œuvres) et de Charles Forget.

Le musée est complété par un centre de documentation spécialisé sur l'histoire, l'architecture et le patrimoine de la région.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sceaux is a commune in the southern suburbs of Paris, France. It is located 9.7 km (6.0 mi) from the center of Paris famous for the Château of Sceaux, set in its large park (Parc départemental de Sceaux), designed by André Le Nôtre, measuring 2 km2 (0.77 sq mi). 

The original château, demolished during the Revolution, was built by Jean-Baptiste Colbert, the minister of finance to Louis XIV and purchased by Louis' illegitimate son, the duke of Maine in 1699. His duchesse held court in a glittering salon at Sceaux in the first decades of the eighteenth century.

The present château, rebuilt 1856-62 in a Louis XIII style, is now the museum of Île-de-France open for visits.

Shanghai | Hazy Lujiazui - PuDong, Shanghai http://farm6.static.flickr.com/5286/5236424710_ae1a3211be_s.jpg The towers of Lujiazui Finance and Trade Zone (陆家嘴金融贸易区) at PuDong, Shanghai(上海浦东新区) - seen from The Bund.

"A Tale of Two Skylines" http://farm5.static.flickr.com/4092/5088126167_9f6921f3a6_s.jpg From Victoria Peak, you can see a view of the two skylines that, together, create the city we recognize as Hong Kong.  In the foreground is Hong Kong proper, situated on Hong Kong Island.  Across Victoria Harbour is Kowloon Peninsula, which borders the Chinese mainland 20 miles (32 km) to the north.

In this photo, you can also see Hong Kong's two tallest buildings, the International Finance Center 2 (IFC2) in the foreground to the extreme right of the frame.  On the Kowloon side, you can see the International Commerce Center (ICC), the city's tallest.  It is not unusual to misname the two buildings given the similarities of their acronyms, in addition to their appearances in design and height.

 London  | Architecture  | Night  Photography   | London Underground


==========================================================================

Docklands is the semi-official name for an area in northeast and southeast London, England. It forms part of the boroughs of Southwark, Tower Hamlets, Newham and Greenwich. The docks were formerly part of the Port of London, at one time the world's largest port. They have now been redeveloped principally for commercial and residential use. The name London Docklands  was used for the first time in a government report on redevelopment plans in 1971 but has since become virtually universally adopted. It also created conflict between the new and old communities of the London Docklands.

en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London_Docklands

==========================================================================


London (pronounced /ˈlʌndən/) is the capital of England and the United Kingdom. A major settlement for two millennia, its history goes back to its founding by the Romans, who called it Londinium.London's core, the ancient City of London, the 'square mile', retains its mediaeval boundaries. Since at least the nineteenth century, the name "London" has also referred to the metropolis developed around it.Today, the bulk of this conurbation forms the London region and the Greater London administrative area,with its own elected mayor and assembly.

London is a major global city and one of the world's largest financial centres with the largest city GDP in Europe. Central London is home to the headquarters of most of the UK's top 100 listed companies (the FTSE 100) and more than 100 of Europe's 500 largest. London's influence in politics, finance, education, entertainment, media, fashion, the arts and culture in general contributes to its global position. FastBill ist schlank, intuitiv und hilft bei wichtigen Aufgaben. Schluß mit nerviger Bürokratie.  Mobil für räumliche und zeitliche Freiheit.  Dank Browser basierter Technologie können Sie flexibel und mobil an jedem Ort arbeiten. Keine Installation. Keine Updates. Keine Probleme.  Korrekt zur Erfüllung formaler Anforderungen.  Ob Kleinunternehmerregelung, steuerliche Rechnungsformalitäten oder digitale Signatur. --English Version--




Le Mont-St-Michel was used in the 6th and 7th centuries as a stronghold of Romano-British 
culture and power until it was sacked by the Franks; thus ending the trans-channel culture that 
had stood since the departure of the Romans in 459 AD. Before the construction of the first 
monastic establishment in the 8th century, the island was called Mont Tombe. According to 
legend, the archangel Michael appeared to St. Aubert, bishop of Avranches, in 708 and instructed 
him to build a church on the rocky islet. But Aubert repeatedly ignored the angel's instruction until 
Michael burned a hole in the bishop's skull with his finger. That did the trick. The dedication to St 
Michael occurred on October 16, 708. The mount gained strategic significance in 933 when the
Normans annexed the Cotentin Peninsula, thereby placing the mount on the new frontier with 
Brittan 48.636081, -1.51083 France, Mont, Saint, St, Michel, Frankreich, Night, nightshot, nachtaufnahme, light

Looming Giants http://farm9.static.flickr.com/8007/7135903121_534db71910_s.jpg 50.113567, 8.668604 Frankfurt, Frankfurt am Main, FFM, Mainhattan, Skyscraper, Highrise, Hochhaus, Sky, Scraper, Deutsche

Un dimanche matin http://farm7.static.flickr.com/6115/6372195821_c2ec9fb9bd_s.jpg Le 20 novembre 2011 au matin :

Sceaux est célèbre pour son immense parc (parc départemental de Sceaux, dessiné par André Le Nôtre, comptant 181 ha dont 120 sur la commune de Sceaux), vestige du domaine personnel de Colbert dont l'imposant château fut détruit sous le Consulat.

Ce château fut la résidence de la duchesse du Maine, bru de Louis XIV.

Le château de Sceaux actuel, beaucoup plus petit, édifié par le deuxième duc de Trévise, fils du maréchal Mortier, sous le Second Empire, est de style néo - Louis XIII.

Le château actuel abrite le musée de la région Île-de-France. Ce musée possède l'une des plus importantes collections d'œuvres de peintres français figuratifs de l'Ecole de Paris et notamment de Maurice Boitel (quatre œuvres) et de Charles Forget.

Le musée est complété par un centre de documentation spécialisé sur l'histoire, l'architecture et le patrimoine de la région.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sceaux is a commune in the southern suburbs of Paris, France. It is located 9.7 km (6.0 mi) from the center of Paris famous for the Château of Sceaux, set in its large park (Parc départemental de Sceaux), designed by André Le Nôtre, measuring 2 km2 (0.77 sq mi). 

The original château, demolished during the Revolution, was built by Jean-Baptiste Colbert, the minister of finance to Louis XIV and purchased by Louis' illegitimate son, the duke of Maine in 1699. His duchesse held court in a glittering salon at Sceaux in the first decades of the eighteenth century.

The present château, rebuilt 1856-62 in a Louis XIII style, is now the museum of Île-de-France open for visits.

Shanghai | Hazy Lujiazui - PuDong, Shanghai http://farm6.static.flickr.com/5286/5236424710_ae1a3211be_s.jpg The towers of Lujiazui Finance and Trade Zone (陆家嘴金融贸易区) at PuDong, Shanghai(上海浦东新区) - seen from The Bund.

My Shanghai Set | My Photostream

The beautiful Shanghai is plagued by pollution.  It is rather hard to have a good view of the buildings in PuDong during the Summer, you'd have to be lucky for the right shot.


View on black.

You can mouse over the buildings to see their name.  If there is anything wrong, please make a change.

3000 views at 2/1/11!! 31.245535, 121.482353 Shanghai, PuDong, 陆家嘴金融贸易区, 陆家嘴, 金融, 浦东新区, 浦东, China, Skyline, PuXi

"A Tale of Two Skylines" http://farm5.static.flickr.com/4092/5088126167_9f6921f3a6_s.jpg From Victoria Peak, you can see a view of the two skylines that, together, create the city we recognize as Hong Kong.  In the foreground is Hong Kong proper, situated on Hong Kong Island.  Across Victoria Harbour is Kowloon Peninsula, which borders the Chinese mainland 20 miles (32 km) to the north.

In this photo, you can also see Hong Kong's two tallest buildings, the International Finance Center 2 (IFC2) in the foreground to the extreme right of the frame.  On the Kowloon side, you can see the International Commerce Center (ICC), the city's tallest.  It is not unusual to misname the two buildings given the similarities of their acronyms, in addition to their appearances in design and height.

London Tunnel of Light - Docklands http://farm5.static.flickr.com/4003/4429084885_e5ec265abb_s.jpg   Please don't use this image on websites, blogs or other media without my explicit permission. © All rights reserved


TWITTER | WWW.DAVIDGUTIERREZ.CO.UK |  SAATCHI ONLINE | YOUTUBE | FACEBOOK | REDBUBBLE 




 London  | Architecture  | Night  Photography   | London Underground


==========================================================================

Docklands is the semi-official name for an area in northeast and southeast London, England. It forms part of the boroughs of Southwark, Tower Hamlets, Newham and Greenwich. The docks were formerly part of the Port of London, at one time the world's largest port. They have now been redeveloped principally for commercial and residential use. The name London Docklands  was used for the first time in a government report on redevelopment plans in 1971 but has since become virtually universally adopted. It also created conflict between the new and old communities of the London Docklands.

en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London_Docklands

==========================================================================


London (pronounced /ˈlʌndən/) is the capital of England and the United Kingdom. A major settlement for two millennia, its history goes back to its founding by the Romans, who called it Londinium.London's core, the ancient City of London, the 'square mile', retains its mediaeval boundaries. Since at least the nineteenth century, the name "London" has also referred to the metropolis developed around it.Today, the bulk of this conurbation forms the London region and the Greater London administrative area,with its own elected mayor and assembly.

London is a major global city and one of the world's largest financial centres with the largest city GDP in Europe. Central London is home to the headquarters of most of the UK's top 100 listed companies (the FTSE 100) and more than 100 of Europe's 500 largest. London's influence in politics, finance, education, entertainment, media, fashion, the arts and culture in general contributes to its global position. It is a 51.509517, -0.016565 Tunnel, Light, Poplar, Docklands, Architecture poplar2010, artofimages, bestcapturesaoi, greatphotographers, Colors, Blue

A crowd drawer  during the 13th Annual Winter Walk at the town of Hudson, New York.
These mamas surely know how to use what their mamas gave them.

FastBill ist schlank, intuitiv und hilft bei wichtigen Aufgaben. Schluß mit nerviger Bürokratie.  Mobil für räumliche und zeitliche Freiheit.  Dank Browser basierter Technologie können Sie flexibel und mobil an jedem Ort arbeiten. Keine Installation. Keine Updates. Keine Probleme.  Korrekt zur Erfüllung formaler Anforderungen.  Ob Kleinunternehmerregelung, steuerliche Rechnungsformalitäten oder digitale Signatur. Un dimanche matin http://farm7.static.flickr.com/6115/6372195821_c2ec9fb9bd_s.jpg Le 20 novembre 2011 au matin :

Sceaux est célèbre pour son immense parc (parc départemental de Sceaux, dessiné par André Le Nôtre, comptant 181 ha dont 120 sur la commune de Sceaux), vestige du domaine personnel de Colbert dont l'imposant château fut détruit sous le Consulat.

Ce château fut la résidence de la duchesse du Maine, bru de Louis XIV.

Le château de Sceaux actuel, beaucoup plus petit, édifié par le deuxième duc de Trévise, fils du maréchal Mortier, sous le Second Empire, est de style néo - Louis XIII.

Le château actuel abrite le musée de la région Île-de-France. Ce musée possède l'une des plus importantes collections d'œuvres de peintres français figuratifs de l'Ecole de Paris et notamment de Maurice Boitel (quatre œuvres) et de Charles Forget.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sceaux is a commune in the southern suburbs of Paris, France. It is located 9.7 km (6.0 mi) from the center of Paris famous for the Château of Sceaux, set in its large park (Parc départemental de Sceaux), designed by André Le Nôtre, measuring 2 km2 (0.77 sq mi). 

The original château, demolished during the Revolution, was built by Jean-Baptiste Colbert, the minister of finance to Louis XIV and purchased by Louis' illegitimate son, the duke of Maine in 1699. His duchesse held court in a glittering salon at Sceaux in the first decades of the eighteenth century.

The present château, rebuilt 1856-62 in a Louis XIII style, is now the museum of Île-de-France open for visits.

"A Tale of Two Skylines" http://farm5.static.flickr.com/4092/5088126167_9f6921f3a6_s.jpg From Victoria Peak, you can see a view of the two skylines that, together, create the city we recognize as Hong Kong.  In the foreground is Hong Kong proper, situated on Hong Kong Island.  Across Victoria Harbour is Kowloon Peninsula, which borders the Chinese mainland 20 miles (32 km) to the north.

In this photo, you can also see Hong Kong's two tallest buildings, the International Finance Center 2 (IFC2) in the foreground to the extreme right of the frame.  On the Kowloon side, you can see the International Commerce Center (ICC), the city's tallest.  It is not unusual to misname the two buildings given the similarities of their acronyms, in addition to their appearances in design and height.

 London  | Architecture  | Night  Photography   | London Underground


==========================================================================

Docklands is the semi-official name for an area in northeast and southeast London, England. It forms part of the boroughs of Southwark, Tower Hamlets, Newham and Greenwich. The docks were formerly part of the Port of London, at one time the world's largest port. They have now been redeveloped principally for commercial and residential use. The name London Docklands  was used for the first time in a government report on redevelopment plans in 1971 but has since become virtually universally adopted. It also created conflict between the new and old communities of the London Docklands.

en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London_Docklands

==========================================================================


London (pronounced /ˈlʌndən/) is the capital of England and the United Kingdom. A major settlement for two millennia, its history goes back to its founding by the Romans, who called it Londinium.London's core, the ancient City of London, the 'square mile', retains its mediaeval boundaries. Since at least the nineteenth century, the name "London" has also referred to the metropolis developed around it.Today, the bulk of this conurbation forms the London region and the Greater London administrative area,with its own elected mayor and assembly.

London is a major global city and one of the world's largest financial centres with the largest city GDP in Europe. Central London is home to the headquarters of most of the UK's top 100 listed companies (the FTSE 100) and more than 100 of Europe's 500 largest. London's influence in politics, finance, education, entertainment, media, fashion, the arts and culture in general contributes to its global position. Le Mont-Saint-Michel **France** http://farm8.static.flickr.com/7103/7386227514_45d941fc47_s.jpg If you enjoy my work and want to support me, you can join my Facebook page
Push there the  "Like Button" and  enjoy my pictures and much, much more! ;)   
Click this link:Oliver Botor Photography

Please press "L" for the best view!

--English Version--




Le Mont-St-Michel was used in the 6th and 7th centuries as a stronghold of Romano-British 
culture and power until it was sacked by the Franks; thus ending the trans-channel culture that 
had stood since the departure of the Romans in 459 AD. Before the construction of the first 
monastic establishment in the 8th century, the island was called Mont Tombe. According to 
legend, the archangel Michael appeared to St. Aubert, bishop of Avranches, in 708 and instructed 
him to build a church on the rocky islet. But Aubert repeatedly ignored the angel's instruction until 
Michael burned a hole in the bishop's skull with his finger. That did the trick. The dedication to St 
Michael occurred on October 16, 708. The mount gained strategic significance in 933 when the
Normans annexed the Cotentin Peninsula, thereby placing the mount on the new frontier with 
Brittan 48.636081, -1.51083 France, Mont, Saint, St, Michel, Frankreich, Night, nightshot, nachtaufnahme, light

Looming Giants http://farm9.static.flickr.com/8007/7135903121_534db71910_s.jpg 50.113567, 8.668604 Frankfurt, Frankfurt am Main, FFM, Mainhattan, Skyscraper, Highrise, Hochhaus, Sky, Scraper, Deutsche

Un dimanche matin http://farm7.static.flickr.com/6115/6372195821_c2ec9fb9bd_s.jpg Le 20 novembre 2011 au matin :

Sceaux est célèbre pour son immense parc (parc départemental de Sceaux, dessiné par André Le Nôtre, comptant 181 ha dont 120 sur la commune de Sceaux), vestige du domaine personnel de Colbert dont l'imposant château fut détruit sous le Consulat.

Ce château fut la résidence de la duchesse du Maine, bru de Louis XIV.

Le château de Sceaux actuel, beaucoup plus petit, édifié par le deuxième duc de Trévise, fils du maréchal Mortier, sous le Second Empire, est de style néo - Louis XIII.

Le château actuel abrite le musée de la région Île-de-France. Ce musée possède l'une des plus importantes collections d'œuvres de peintres français figuratifs de l'Ecole de Paris et notamment de Maurice Boitel (quatre œuvres) et de Charles Forget.

Le musée est complété par un centre de documentation spécialisé sur l'histoire, l'architecture et le patrimoine de la région.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sceaux is a commune in the southern suburbs of Paris, France. It is located 9.7 km (6.0 mi) from the center of Paris famous for the Château of Sceaux, set in its large park (Parc départemental de Sceaux), designed by André Le Nôtre, measuring 2 km2 (0.77 sq mi). 

The original château, demolished during the Revolution, was built by Jean-Baptiste Colbert, the minister of finance to Louis XIV and purchased by Louis' illegitimate son, the duke of Maine in 1699. His duchesse held court in a glittering salon at Sceaux in the first decades of the eighteenth century.

The present château, rebuilt 1856-62 in a Louis XIII style, is now the museum of Île-de-France open for visits.

==========================================================================

Docklands is the semi-official name for an area in northeast and southeast London, England. It forms part of the boroughs of Southwark, Tower Hamlets, Newham and Greenwich. The docks were formerly part of the Port of London, at one time the world's largest port. They have now been redeveloped principally for commercial and residential use. The name London Docklands  was used for the first time in a government report on redevelopment plans in 1971 but has since become virtually universally adopted. It also created conflict between the new and old communities of the London Docklands.

en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London_Docklands

London (pronounced /ˈlʌndən/) is the capital of England and the United Kingdom. A major settlement for two millennia, its history goes back to its founding by the Romans, who called it Londinium.London's core, the ancient City of London, the 'square mile', retains its mediaeval boundaries. The festival was participated by many business owners and residents.
This street of Warren is home to many art galleries and antique shops aside from banking and finance, restaurant, boutiques and shops. 
  For details click this link: www.hudsonoperahouse.org/winterwalk.html

Billomat | Rechnungen einfach online schreiben. http://www.billomat.com/ In der Cloud Weil Billomat ausschließlich im Internet lebt, arbeitest du stets mit der aktuellsten Version und profitierst automatisch von neuen Features. International Billomat ist komplett in 5 Sprachen lokalisiert und wird von Kunden aus der ganzen Welt genutzt. Sicherheit Alle Daten werden SSL- verschlüsselt übertragen und sind in unserem Rechenzentrum mehrfach redundant als Backup verfügbar. Mehr zur Sicherheit » Umweltfreundlich Mit Billomat sparst du Papier, Tinte und Energie. Das schont die natürlichen Ressourcen und die Umwelt. Schnittstellen Mit integrierten Add-Ons oder offener REST-API Daten mit anderen Diensten austauschen. Ob Zeiterfassung, Projektmanagement, Briefversand, … Support Auch auf Twitter Bei Billomat arbeiten echte Menschen, die du bei Fragen und Problemen zeitnah erreichen kannst. Wir helfen dir gerne weiter! Zum Support-Portal » accounting, billing, business, finance, service, software, webbased

Rechnung online erstellen, Kunden verwalten, Kosten im Überblick http://www.fastbill.com/ Vielseitig für alle Bereiche  des Arbeitsalltags.  Kunden verwalten, Angebote und Rechnungen erstellen, Projekte managen. Behalten Sie Einnahmen, Ausgaben und die Liquidität im Blick.  Zeitsparend beim täglichen Papierkram.  Arbeitszeiten erfassen und abrechnen, wiederkehrende Rechnungen automatisch erzeugen. Arbeiten Sie online, schnell und effizient.  Kollaborativ mit Kunden und im Team arbeiten.  Einfache Kundenverwaltung und Teamwork. Dank Rechtekonzept arbeiten Sie effizient mit Kollegen oder Dienstleistern.  Schlank auf das Wesentliche reduziert.  Komplexe Buchhaltungssoftware war gestern! FastBill ist schlank, intuitiv und hilft bei wichtigen Aufgaben. Schluß mit nerviger Bürokratie.  Mobil für räumliche und zeitliche Freiheit.  Dank Browser basierter Technologie können Sie flexibel und mobil an jedem Ort arbeiten. Keine Installation. Keine Updates. Keine Probleme.  Korrekt zur Erfüllung formaler Anforderungen.  Ob Kleinunternehmerregelung, steuerliche Rechnungsformalitäten oder digitale Signatur. Mit FastBill machen Sie automatisch alles richtig. accounting, billing, business, finance, service, software, timetracking, webbased

Le Mont-Saint-Michel **France** http://farm8.static.flickr.com/7103/7386227514_45d941fc47_s.jpg If you enjoy my work and want to support me, you can join my Facebook page
Push there the  "Like Button" and  enjoy my pictures and much, much more! ;)   
Click this link:Oliver Botor Photography

Please press "L" for the best view!




































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































































All of the pictures are © copyright by Oliver Botor "All rights are reserved" worldwide. 
Please do not use, copy or edit any of my photographs. However please feel free to contact 
with me if you are interested in using any of my images.









--English Version--




Le Mont-St-Michel was used in the 6th and 7th centuries as a stronghold of Romano-British 
culture and power until it was sacked by the Franks; thus ending the trans-channel culture that 
had stood since the departure of the Romans in 459 AD. Before the construction of the first 
monastic establishment in the 8th century, the island was called Mont Tombe. According to 
legend, the archangel Michael appeared to St. Aubert, bishop of Avranches, in 708 and instructed 
him to build a church on the rocky islet. But Aubert repeatedly ignored the angel's instruction until 
Michael burned a hole in the bishop's skull with his finger. That did the trick. The dedication to St 
Michael occurred on October 16, 708. The mount gained strategic significance in 933 when the
Normans annexed the Cotentin Peninsula, thereby placing the mount on the new frontier with 
Brittan 48.636081, -1.51083 France, Mont, Saint, St, Michel, Frankreich, Night, nightshot, nachtaufnahme, light

Looming Giants http://farm9.static.flickr.com/8007/7135903121_534db71910_s.jpg 50.113567, 8.668604 Frankfurt, Frankfurt am Main, FFM, Mainhattan, Skyscraper, Highrise, Hochhaus, Sky, Scraper, Deutsche

Un dimanche matin http://farm7.static.flickr.com/6115/6372195821_c2ec9fb9bd_s.jpg Le 20 novembre 2011 au matin :

Sceaux est célèbre pour son immense parc (parc départemental de Sceaux, dessiné par André Le Nôtre, comptant 181 ha dont 120 sur la commune de Sceaux), vestige du domaine personnel de Colbert dont l'imposant château fut détruit sous le Consulat.

Ce château fut la résidence de la duchesse du Maine, bru de Louis XIV.

Le château de Sceaux actuel, beaucoup plus petit, édifié par le deuxième duc de Trévise, fils du maréchal Mortier, sous le Second Empire, est de style néo - Louis XIII.

Le château actuel abrite le musée de la région Île-de-France. Ce musée possède l'une des plus importantes collections d'œuvres de peintres français figuratifs de l'Ecole de Paris et notamment de Maurice Boitel (quatre œuvres) et de Charles Forget.

Le musée est complété par un centre de documentation spécialisé sur l'histoire, l'architecture et le patrimoine de la région.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sceaux is a commune in the southern suburbs of Paris, France. It is located 9.7 km (6.0 mi) from the center of Paris famous for the Château of Sceaux, set in its large park (Parc départemental de Sceaux), designed by André Le Nôtre, measuring 2 km2 (0.77 sq mi). 

The original château, demolished during the Revolution, was built by Jean-Baptiste Colbert, the minister of finance to Louis XIV and purchased by Louis' illegitimate son, the duke of Maine in 1699. His duchesse held court in a glittering salon at Sceaux in the first decades of the eighteenth century.

The present château, rebuilt 1856-62 in a Louis XIII style, is now the museum of Île-de-France open for visits.

Hong Kong - Aerial View http://farm6.static.flickr.com/5208/5299340791_6aeacd24c8_s.jpg Quick snap from the airplane while arriving at Hong Kong on Dec. 28th 2010. Lower left is a section of Hong Kong Island (Central to Wanchai), about middle right is Kowloon (Tsim Sha Tsui and West Kowloon). Upper left Tsing Yi Island, the Rambler Channel and Tsuen Wan.

Pretty clear air, but still needed some PP to really clean it up. 

I've added a few notes - most with links to closer views of the respective object. You may want to see this in LARGE format.

The location from where the shot is taken is naturally just a rough estimate...

Shanghai | Hazy Lujiazui - PuDong, Shanghai http://farm6.static.flickr.com/5286/5236424710_ae1a3211be_s.jpg The towers of Lujiazui Finance and Trade Zone (陆家嘴金融贸易区) at PuDong, Shanghai(上海浦东新区) - seen from The Bund.

My Shanghai Set | My Photostream

The beautiful Shanghai is plagued by pollution.  It is rather hard to have a good view of the buildings in PuDong during the Summer, you'd have to be lucky for the right shot.


View on black.

You can mouse over the buildings to see their name.  If there is anything wrong, please make a change.

P.S. 2000 views at 1/20/11, thank you!!
3000 views at 2/1/11!! 31.245535, 121.482353 Shanghai, PuDong, 陆家嘴金融贸易区, 陆家嘴, 金融, 浦东新区, 浦东, China, Skyline, PuXi

"A Tale of Two Skylines" http://farm5.static.flickr.com/4092/5088126167_9f6921f3a6_s.jpg From Victoria Peak, you can see a view of the two skylines that, together, create the city we recognize as Hong Kong.  In the foreground is Hong Kong proper, situated on Hong Kong Island.  Across Victoria Harbour is Kowloon Peninsula, which borders the Chinese mainland 20 miles (32 km) to the north.

In this photo, you can also see Hong Kong's two tallest buildings, the International Finance Center 2 (IFC2) in the foreground to the extreme right of the frame.  On the Kowloon side, you can see the International Commerce Center (ICC), the city's tallest.  It is not unusual to misname the two buildings given the similarities of their acronyms, in addition to their appearances in design and height.

TIA INTERNATIONAL PHOTOGRAPHY / TIA Facebook / TIA Twitter 22.268997, 114.150073 Hong Kong, China, East, Asia, Pacific, Victoria, Peak, metropolis, architecture, cosmopolitan

Shanghai - Lujiazui, over the tops http://farm5.static.flickr.com/4141/4900246880_b3a59a657a_s.jpg Some of the skyscrapers in the Lujiazui Financial District:

1. SWFC, Shanghai World Financial Center (上海环球金融中心), 492m
2. New Shanghai International Tower (新上海国际大厦), 168m
3. World Finance Tower (世界金融大厦), 200m 
4. Jin Mao Tower (金茂大厦), 420m
5. Huaxia Bank Tower (华夏银行大厦), 160m
(Spire heights, where applicaple)

Docklands is the semi-official name for an area in northeast and southeast London, England. It forms part of the boroughs of Southwark, Tower Hamlets, Newham and Greenwich. The docks were formerly part of the Port of London, at one time the world's largest port. They have now been redeveloped principally for commercial and residential use. The name London Docklands  was used for the first time in a government report on redevelopment plans in 1971 but has since become virtually universally adopted. It also created conflict between the new and old communities of the London Docklands.

en.wikipedia.org/wiki/London_Docklands

==========================================================================


London (pronounced /ˈlʌndən/) is the capital of England and the United Kingdom. A major settlement for two millennia, its history goes back to its founding by the Romans, who called it Londinium.London's core, the ancient City of London, the 'square mile', retains its mediaeval boundaries. Since at least the nineteenth century, the name "London" has also referred to the metropolis developed around it.Today, the bulk of this conurbation forms the London region and the Greater London administrative area,with its own elected mayor and assembly.

London is a major global city and one of the world's largest financial centres with the largest city GDP in Europe. Central London is home to the headquarters of most of the UK's top 100 listed companies (the FTSE 100) and more than 100 of Europe's 500 largest. London's influence in politics, finance, education, entertainment, media, fashion, the arts and culture in general contributes to its global position. It is a 51.509517, -0.016565 Tunnel, Light, Poplar, Docklands, Architecture poplar2010, artofimages, bestcapturesaoi, greatphotographers, Colors, Blue
